Vectors

Example Code
10.1-vector.cpp 10.2-moreVector.cpp 10.3-sieve.cpp 10.4-split.cpp

Minor correction; calling the vector constructor with one int argument (n) will create a vector of size n with each element default initialized (0 for numbers, empty for strings, etc.). So std::vector vec(5); will result in a vector of 5 ones. Secondly, the capacity of a vector is only guarenteed to be equal or greater than the size. Its exact value (at constructor or later) is determined by the memory allocation used in a particular C++ implementation.
